content.raw: I see risk here yes. I confirmed that we are exporting a lot of symbols present in both libigniton-math2.so and libignition-math3.so. In runtime, if we mix libraries and executable binaries linked against different major versions of the library, if I'm not wrong, the loader would load both (no conflict resolution in the loader) and use the symbols from the first one. As Silvio mentioned, if one of those symbols has changed (breaking the ABI) we could be in problems.
content.html: I see risk here yes. I confirmed that we are exporting a lot of symbols present in both libigniton-math2.so and libignition-math3.so. In runtime, if we mix libraries and executable binaries linked against different major versions of the library, if I'm not wrong, the loader would load both (no conflict resolution in the loader) and use the symbols from the first one. As Silvio mentioned, if one of those symbols has changed (breaking the ABI) we could be in problems.
